m:properties.d:Title: .NET Distributed Systems Architecture
m:properties.d:Description: This course provides an overview of the architecture and technology used to build distributed sytems on the Microsoft platform. The course looks at the general knowledge one needs prior to building a distributed system. There is a focus on design patterns and concepts as well as an overview of the key technologies used by Microsoft .NET developers.
m:properties.d:Name: dotnet-distributed-architecture
m:properties.d:ShortDescription: This course provides an overview of the architecture and technology used to build distributed sytems on the Microsoft platform.

m:properties.d:Title: Introduction to WCF
m:properties.d:Description: Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) is the next-generation platform for building connected systems on the Windows platform. WCF makes it possible to build secure, reliable, and transacted services that can be composed into service-oriented applications. WCF makes this easy through a simplified programming model that unifies and improves many of the previous .NET distributed technologies like ASP.NET Web Services (ASMX), Web Services Enhancements (WSE), .NET Remoting, .NET Enterprise Services (COM+), and System.Messaging. Not only is WCF simpler to use than its predecessors, it's also more flexible and highly interoperable thanks to its support for industry standards and protocols like REST, SOAP, and the various WS-* specifications. WCF is sure to change the way every .NET developer builds connected systems in the years ahead. This course provides fast-paced exposure to WCF and will help you get started today.
m:properties.d:Name: wcf-fundamentals
m:properties.d:ShortDescription: Learn how to build modern connected systems on the Microsoft platform using Windows Communication Foundation.

m:properties.d:Title: WCF 4 New Features
m:properties.d:Description: This course covers updates to WCF between 3.5 and 4.0. A number of changes were made to make configuration easier and to better integrate WCF REST with ASP.NET. WCF 4.0 also includes new features to support Discovery and Routing.
m:properties.d:Name: wcf4-newfeatures
m:properties.d:ShortDescription: This course explains a number of the enhancements to WCF 4.0 over the WCF 3.5 SP1 release.

m:properties.d:Title: WCF Advanced Topics
m:properties.d:Description: Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) is the next-generation platform for building connected systems on the Windows platform. WCF makes it possible to build secure, reliable, and transacted services that can be composed into service-oriented applications. WCF makes this easy through a simplified programming model that unifies and improves many of the previous .NET distributed technologies like ASP.NET Web Services (ASMX), Web Services Enhancements (WSE), .NET Remoting, .NET Enterprise Services (COM+), and System.Messaging. Not only is WCF simpler to use than its predecessors, it's also more flexible and highly interoperable thanks to its support for industry standards and protocols like REST, SOAP, and the various WS-* specifications. WCF is sure to change the way every .NET developer builds connected systems in the years ahead. This course covers the more advanced topics in WCF.
m:properties.d:Name: wcf-advanced-topics
m:properties.d:ShortDescription: Learn how to build modern connected systems on the Microsoft platform using Windows Communication Foundation.

m:properties.d:Title: WCF by Example
m:properties.d:Description: Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) is the next-generation platform for building connected systems on the Windows platform. WCF makes it possible to build secure, reliable, and transacted services that can be composed into service-oriented applications.
m:properties.d:Name: wcf-by-example
m:properties.d:ShortDescription: Learn how to build modern connected systems on the Microsoft platform using Windows Communication Foundation through sample demos.

m:properties.d:Title: WCF For Architects
m:properties.d:Description: This course provides an introduction to WCF. It then covers how to use WCF for the enterprise and for the Web. It covers two aspects all architects and .NET developers need to understand: versioning and serialization.
m:properties.d:Name: wcf-for-architects
m:properties.d:ShortDescription: This course covers how to incorporate WCF in your application architecture.

m:properties.d:Title: WCF Fundamentals
m:properties.d:Description: Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) is the next-generation platform for building connected systems on the Windows platform. WCF makes it possible to build secure, reliable, and transacted services that can be composed into service-oriented applications. WCF makes this easy through a simplified programming model that unifies and improves many of the previous .NET distributed technologies like ASP.NET Web Services (ASMX), Web Services Enhancements (WSE), .NET Remoting, .NET Enterprise Services (COM+), and System.Messaging. Not only is WCF simpler to use than its predecessors, it's also more flexible and highly interoperable thanks to its support for industry standards and protocols like REST, SOAP, and the various WS-* specifications. WCF is sure to change the way every .NET developer builds connected systems in the years ahead. This course covers the system-design features of WCF.
m:properties.d:Name: wcf-design-concepts
m:properties.d:ShortDescription: Learn how to build modern connected systems on the Microsoft platform using Windows Communication Foundation.

m:properties.d:Title: WCF REST Starter Kit by Example
m:properties.d:Description: Learn how to become productive with the WCF REST Starter Kit. You'll see how to install the WCF REST Starter Kit on your machine, navigate the documentation, samples, and project templates, and you'll see how to quickly get started with a simple RESTful service implementation. We then explore different data representations, resource services, atom and atompub services, as well as POX (plain old XML) services.
m:properties.d:Name: wcf-rest-by-example
m:properties.d:ShortDescription: Learn how to use the WCF REST Starter Kit.

m:properties.d:Title: WCF REST Starter Kit HttpClient by Example
m:properties.d:Description: Learn how to become productive with the WCF REST Starter Kit. You'll see how to install the WCF REST Starter Kit on your machine, navigate the documentation, samples, and project templates, and you'll see how to quickly get started with a simple RESTful service implementation. We then explore different data representations, resource services, atom and atompub services, as well as POX (plain old XML) services.
m:properties.d:Name: wcf-rest-httpclient-by-example
m:properties.d:ShortDescription: Learn how to use the WCF REST Starter Kit.
